thread.title: Russian model in hot water after dangling from atop Dubai skyscraper
thread.title_full: Russian model in hot water after dangling from atop Dubai skyscraper

author: Mary Bowerman
title: Russian model in hot water after dangling from atop Dubai skyscraper
text:
Russian model in hot water after dangling from atop Dubai skyscraper USA TODAY 8 hrs ago Mary Bowerman Click to expand Replay Video The 14 Best Oscars Dresses of the Last Decade The Oscars dress: For many, it’s what originally catalyzed a love of fashion. And while there are a great number of memorable frocks from eras prior, we’ve decided to showcase the past ten-plus years’ ceremonies and their respective best-dressed, from Julianne More to Gwyneth Paltrow to Alicia Vikander. Vogue 6 Problems That Come With A Bad Hair Day We've all had those days when our hair just doesn't want to cooperate with us! Well these are all struggles that any one who's had a bad hair day can totally understand. Thank goodness for hats and hair ties that are always there to help save the day! Just ask these super adorable little kids who can't get enough hugs! Sometimes it's good to take a page from these adorable kids and learn how to be kind again! Viral Clips Daily SETTINGS OFF HD HQ SD LO See Instagram model lives dangle from 1,000 feet skyscraper TODAY See more videos SHARE SHARE TWEET SHARE EMAIL What to watch next The 14 Best Oscars Dresses of the Last Decade Vogue 0:51 6 Problems That Come With A Bad Hair Day Viral Clips Daily 1:03 9 Reasons Why Hugs Are The Best Viral Clips Daily 1:15 Kate Middleton Recycles a 5-Year-Old Coat E! Online 0:45 5 Natural Ways to Fight PMS Instyle 1:03 A New Way To Save The Planet? Leggings Made From Water Bottles Newsy 0:36 The slim wallet is the ultimate style upgrade GQ - Videos 0:39 Runway Remix: Watch Our Recap of New York Fashion Week Fall/Winter 2017 Instyle 1:23 5 surprising things that can trigger asthma attacks Health 0:54 Tone up in three moves Golf Digest 1:11 This Accessory Is Crucial For The Winter Season Esquire 0:33 Baby moonwalks to Michael Jackson's 'Beat It' USA TODAY 1:04 See how this jewelry is made out of love letters TODAY 0:55 This Two-Step Monochromatic Eye Look Is About to Be Your New Go-To PureWow 0:35 An Easy Way to Work Out When You Have Literally Zero Time Instyle 0:37 The olive suit is the ultimate style upgrade GQ - Videos 0:47 UP NEXT A Russian model took her quest for the perfect Instagram photo to dizzying heights by dangling from atop a Dubai skyscraper.
Video taken of the incident and uploaded on Instagram shows Viki Odintcova, 23, lean off the ledge of a skyscraper as a male assistant holds her hand. The model later holds the man's hand and dangles off of the 1,004-foot-high Cayan Tower.
While video of the risky photoshoot gained hundreds of thousands of views on Instagram, the building's developers weren’t amused.
© Instagram / viki_odintcova Cayan Group, the developer of the building, condemned Odintcova’s stunt, which was performed without the knowledge of the company and “without any restraints, or safety precautions.”
While extreme sporting events have been held at the Cayan Tower, there were always trained professionals with backup safety measures, Gizel Daher, Director of Marketing & Communications said in a statement Friday.
“Under no circumstances can we condone Ms. Odintcova’s irresponsible actions, and we are in the process of reviewing our security procedures to understand and rectify where the lapse occurred and how to prevent such in the future,” Gizel Daher said.
The group said it plans to take legal action against the model.
WARNING: If you’re terrified of heights, your palms will likely be sweating after watching this.
Odintcova told The National she doesn’t plan on repeating the incident, but said she and the team deserved compensation for the risky photoshoot.
"We deserve a reward for disclosing weaknesses in the security of that building," Odintcova told The National in an email. "We were at the rooftop of that building without any evil intentions, however someone else could have come out there to commit suicide or an act of terrorism."
Dubai Police Maj. Gen. Khalil Ibrahim Al Mansouri told The National that the model "had been summoned to sign an undertaking not to repeat any dangerous moves that could endanger her life in Dubai."
Odintcova told the paper she was sorry and would sign the papers if the police sent them to her in the mail.
